conclusion: Apply principles of static friction and law of moments
Identify forces: mass of A is 1 kg, mass of B is 2 kg, max static friction between A and B is 1 N, kinetic friction coefficient between B and ground is 0.1
Frictional force between A and ground is 1 N
Frictional force between B and ground is 2 N
Maximum force F that can be applied to B without causing A and B to move is 2 N
Apply law of moments to block B
Sum of applied force F and frictional force must equal combined mass of block B, calculated as 3 N
Maximum force F that can be applied to block B is 2 N
Condition for keeping A and B relatively stationary is F does not exceed 2 N
Final answer: Maximum force F that can be applied to block B without causing A and B to move is 2 N
